channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: インドの選挙期間中、11のWhatsAppベースのファクトチェック「タレコミライン」をテストしたところ、回答に長い遅延と矛盾があることが判明（Rest of World）
item.description:
Rest of World:
A test of 11 WhatsApp-based fact-checking “tip lines” during elections in India finds long delays and inconsistencies in responses  —  Rest of World tested 11 leading WhatsApp-based chatbots that promise to help Indian voters identify misinformation.

item.title: ワシントン・ポスト紙によると、2021年にアリト判事宅でアメリカ国旗が逆さまになっていたことは知っていたが、政治とは関係なさそうなので報道しなかったという（ワシントン・ポスト紙）
item.description:
Washington Post:
The Washington Post says it knew about the upside-down US flag at Justice Alito's house in 2021 but did not report it as it didn't seem related to politics  —  In January 2021, Martha-Ann Alito said the flag, a symbol embraced by election deniers, was raised outside her home in response to a neighborhood dispute.

item.title: ナショナルジオグラフィックは、タリバンがアフガニスタンの地雷除去作業員を殺害した後、ドキュメンタリー『レトログレード』をすべてのプラットフォームから削除した。
item.description:
Washington Post:
National Geographic pulled the documentary Retrograde from all its platforms after the Taliban killed an Afghan mine-clearer the 2022 film prominently featured  —  National Geographic has pulled the Emmy-winning film “Retrograde” from its streaming platforms after criticism from veterans and inquiries from The Washington Post.

item.title: アップルミュージックの「ベストアルバム100」リストは、約250人の従業員、アーティスト、業界幹部からの投票に基づくもので、折衷的で、予測不可能で、物議を醸している（Ben Cohen/Wall Street Journal）。
item.description:
Ben Cohen / Wall Street Journal:
Apple Music's “100 Best Albums” list, based on votes from about 250 employees, artists, and industry executives, is eclectic, unpredictable, and controversial  —  Why did a trillion-dollar company make a music list that would make people lose their minds?

item.title: ソニーのエンタテインメント部門、2023年度の売上高に占める割合は10年前の30％から60％へ、パラマウント買収の可能性を前に（Jacky Wong/Wall Street Journal）
item.description:
Jacky Wong / Wall Street Journal:
A look at Sony's entertainment unit, which accounted for ~60% of Sony revenue in FY 2023, up from 30% a decade ago, ahead of a potential Paramount deal  —  Company aims to make better use of intellectual property across gaming, films and more  —  Sony is well known for gadgets …

item.title: シアトルの『ノースウエスト・アジアン・ウィークリー』誌の発行者が、『シアトル・チャイニーズ・ポスト』紙を非営利団体に寄付してから7ヶ月後に、同誌を地元のパートナー4社に売却した（Vivian Lee/Northwest Asian Weekly）。
item.description:
Vivian Lee / Northwest Asian Weekly:
The publisher of Seattle's Northwest Asian Weekly sells the outlet to four local partners, seven months after donating the Seattle Chinese Post to a nonprofit  —  After decades of nurturing one of the most influential Asian American community media publications in the Pacific Northwest …

item.title: ガザのジャーナリストShrouq Al Aila氏とのQ&A：機材が乏しく、インターネットのコストもかかるAin Mediaの活動の難しさなどについて（Doja Daoud/Committee to Protect ...）
item.description:
Doja Daoud / Committee to Protect Journalists:
Q&A with Gaza journalist Shrouq Al Aila, on the difficulty of her outlet Ain Media's work given a dearth of equipment and the cost of internet, and more  —  Gaza journalists Shrouq Al Aila and Roshdi Sarraj were on a work trip in Saudi Arabia last fall when their home became a war zone.

item.title: ストリーミング・バンドルとケーブル・バンドルの比較は見当違いだ：後者ははるかに高価で、視聴者が望まないチャンネルやジャンク料金があった（Janko Roettgers/Lowpass）
item.description:
Janko Roettgers / Lowpass:
Comparisons between streaming bundles and the cable bundle are misplaced: the latter was much more expensive and had channels viewers didn't want and junk fees  —  Like comparing apples to a $125 fruit salad  —  In light of this week's news that Comcast is now offering a bundle of Netflix …

item.title: カーペンター・メディア社がコミュニティ・ニュースペーパー・ホールディングス社からアラバマ州とジョージア州の新聞10紙とジョージア州の印刷施設を買収（チャタヌーガ・タイムズ・フリープレス紙）
item.description:
Chattanooga Times Free Press:
Carpenter Media acquires 10 newspapers in Alabama and Georgia and a Georgia printing facility from Community Newspaper Holdings  —  The Carpenter Media Group announced Thursday it has acquired the Dalton Daily Citizen in North Georgia as part of an acquisition of 10 newspapers and a Valdosta …

item.title: ニューヨーク市の移民を取材する『Documented』は、カリブ海系移民にリーチするためにネクストドアへの投稿を試み、その他にはWeChatやWhatsAppを利用している（Hanaa' Tameez/Nieman Lab）
item.description:
Hanaa' Tameez / Nieman Lab:
Documented, which covers immigration in New York City, experiments with posts on Nextdoor to reach Caribbean immigrants and uses WeChat and WhatsApp for others  —  “We are bringing onto this platform — where people usually talk about their lost cat or that they're looking for an apartment …

item.title: 1月にZeeとの合併が破綻したソニー・インディアのNP・シン代表が、年齢と個人的な理由を理由に退任する予定。
item.description:
Variety:
Sony India head NP Singh plans to step down, after a merger with Zee collapsed in January, citing age and personal reasons; Singh has been at SPNI for 25 years  —  NP Singh, the well-respected head of Sony's entertainment businesses in India, is to step down.  —  The announcement was made on Friday local time.

item.title: 英国、メディア法案を可決、出版社に勝訴・敗訴にかかわらず裁判費用の全額負担を義務付けた未制定の犯罪・裁判所法第40条を廃止（Dominic Ponsford/Press Gazette）
item.description:
Dominic Ponsford / Press Gazette:
UK passes the Media Bill, repealing the not-yet-enacted Section 40 of the Crime and Courts Act, which required publishers to pay all court costs, win or lose  —  The Media Bill has been passed removing the threat of state-backed press regulation and modernising broadcasting regulations for the streaming age.

item.title: 2023年下半期にNetflixで最も視聴されたタイトルは『Leave the World Behind』で、1億2100万回再生され、最も視聴されたシリーズは『ONE PIECE』で、7160万回再生された（Todd Spangler/Variety）
item.description:
Todd Spangler / Variety:
Leave the World Behind was the most-watched title on Netflix globally in H2 2023, with 121M views, while One Piece was the most-watched series, with 71.6M views  —  Dystopian thriller “Leave the World Behind” was the most-watched film — and title overall — on Netflix globally in the second half of 2023 …

item.title: メディア・マターズ、十数人のスタッフを解雇 法的措置に対する防衛とメディア状況の変化を理由に（Ted Johnson/Deadline）
item.description:
Ted Johnson / Deadline:
Media Matters lays off over a dozen staffers, citing its defense against legal action and the shifting media landscape  —  Media Matters for America, the progressive watchdog journalism organization, underwent a round of layoffs today, as its president cited the shifting media landscape as well as its defense against legal action.

item.title: パラマウントとチャーターが新たな複数年契約を結び、2024年後半にチャーター加入者に広告付き版「Paramount+」と「BET+」を無料配信（The Hollywood Reporter）
item.description:
The Hollywood Reporter:
Paramount and Charter reach a new multiyear carriage deal, adding the ad-supported versions of Paramount+ and BET+ for free to Charter subscribers later in 2024  —  The news comes at a critical moment for the entertainment company.
